properties.areaDesc: South and Southeast Grand/West Central and Southwest Boulder/Gilpin/Clear Creek/Summit/North and West Park Counties Above 9000 Feet; South and East Jackson/Larimer/North and Northeast Grand/Northwest Boulder Counties Above 9000 Feet
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 1 at 3:58PM MST until January 2 at 12:00PM MST by NWS Denver CO
properties.description:
...SNOW CONTINUING IN THE NORTHERN COLORADO MOUNTAINS...

.Snow will increase again this evening before tapering off
early Thursday. Gusty winds of 35 to 50 mph can be expected on
mountain passes, with even higher winds in backcountry areas. The
winds will produce blowing and drifting snow and reduced
visibilities. The heaviest snow totals can be expected in the
mountains north of Rabbit Ears Pass, with moderate accumulations
elsewhere in the northern Colorado mountains.

* WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches.
Winds gusting as high as 65 mph.

* WHERE...The Mountains of Summit County, the Mosquito Range,
and the Indian Peaks and Rocky Mountain National Park and the
Medicine Bow Range.

* WHEN...Until noon MST Thursday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions, especially this
evening. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce
visibility.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or
visiting www.cotrip.org.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MST THURSDAY
